sentences.en: A prudent man saves part of his wages.
sentences.cn: 深谋远虑的人会将一部分工资存起来.

sentences.en: Be modest and prudent, never lag behind!
sentences.cn: 谦虚谨慎, 永不落后!

sentences.en: Because his judgement was prudent, his insights were central to any consultation.
sentences.cn: 因为他考虑问题很慎重, 所以他的意见在每次磋商时都最受重视.

sentences.en: Being a prudent and cautious person, you realise that the problem must be resolved.
sentences.cn: 慎重小心的人都会意识到这个问题非解决不可。

sentences.en: He had always been modest and prudent and remained so after he had become famous.
sentences.cn: 他一直谦虚谨慎,成名之后仍然如此.

sentences.en: His conduct would be prudent and cautious; neither extreme nor ostentatious.
sentences.cn: 他的举止总是小心、谨慎, 既不偏激,也不拘谨.

sentences.en: It might be more prudent to get a second opinion before going ahead.
sentences.cn: 行动之前再征求一下意见也许更为慎重。

sentences.en: It might be prudent not to overwork those good angels.
sentences.cn: 不过还是谨慎点儿,别让这些善良的天使操劳过度.

sentences.en: It would be prudent to save some of the money.
Prudent is wisdom in everyday life.
sentences.cn: 在日常生活中,谨慎就是智慧.

sentences.en: Prudent people are not going to take a leap in the dark.
sentences.cn: 小心谨慎的人是不会轻易冒险的。

sentences.en: She was generous, amiable, interesting; she was everything but prudent.
sentences.cn: 她慷慨大方, 和蔼可亲,逗人喜欢, 除了不够谨慎之外, 她什么都好.

sentences.en: The president of the Republic oscillated between a certain audacity and a prudent realism.
sentences.cn: 该共和国总统施政风格时而大胆冒进，时而谨慎务实。

sentences.en: Tone down your kamikaze tendencies and take more prudent risks.
sentences.cn: 别那么玩命，冒险时要谨慎些。

sentences.en: We should be modest and prudent, guard against arrogance and rashness, and serve the people heart and soul.
sentences.cn: 我们应该谦虚谨慎, 戒骄戒躁, 全心全意为人民服务.

phrases.tran_cn: 稳健的货币政策；谨慎的货币政策

trans.tran_cn: 小心的，慎重的，精明的，节俭的，顾虑周到的，稳健的，世故的，精明的
trans.tran_en: sensible and careful, especially by trying to avoid unnecessary risks
